title: Installation issue: meson packages can't strip on macOS
body:
So far, I've noticed that this bug affects the following packages:

* at-spi2-atk
* at-spi2-core
* atk
* gdk-pixbuf

It likely affects all meson packages on macOS.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install at-spi2-core
...
Stripping target 'atspi/libatspi.0.dylib' using strip.
Could not strip file.

Stdout:


Stderr:
/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/strip: error: symbols referenced by indirect symbol table entries that can't be stripped in: /Users/Adam/spack/opt/spack/darwin-catalina-x86_64/apple-clang-12.0.0/at-spi2-core-2.38.0-kgbdezwlu3gy4ahg64ekaeqtjhei2ehn/lib/libatspi.0.dylib
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.15.4-1763-3576953558
* **Python:** 3.8.6
* **Platform:** darwin-catalina-ivybridge

### Additional information

@michaelkuhn have you ever seen anything like this before? I tried the latest version of meson, ninja, and these 3 packages, but I can't seem to fix them. Homebrew doesn't have any patches either.

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
